intro: Thesium corsalpinum, commonly known as the Corsican thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often found in Mediterranean regions. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, producing showy, yellowish to orange-colored blooms. Thesium corsalpinum is known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations and its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
